data.title: Last Book In The Universe Theme - 820 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: In the book “The Last Book in the Universe”,the author Rodman Philbrick used the main character Spaz to narrate the story. The book tells what...
data.text:
In the book “The Last Book in the Universe”,the author Rodman Philbrick used the main character Spaz to narrate the story. The book tells what happened 200 hundred years after an enormous earthquake, also known as “ The Big Shake”. Throughout the book characters like Spaz, Ryter, Bean and Lanaya change in a positive way that society wouldn’t really approve of. All the characters in the book go along with society at the beginning of the book. By the end of the book each individual take risks and speak up for themselves against what society would expect them to do. The theme of “The Last Book in the Universe” is the individual versus society . The effect of the theme encourages the characters to build up friendship, courage, trust, and companionship. There are many characters that society changes in a bad way. For example, they invented mind probes which is like a movie in your mind by injecting a needle in your brain. Society erased any works of reading and writing with mind probes in the Urb, which is an area inhabited by normals like Spaz. Spaz is the exact opposite of society because he is epileptic. Spaz best explains his brain disorder in a quote “Stick one of those (needles)in my brain and it’ll kick off a …show more content…

Society creates proovs like Lanaya to feel superior to any normal living in the Urb. Lanaya isn’t like any other proov she feels excitement from helping out normals such as Spaz. Throughout the book Lanaya changes her opinion on normals by helping Spaz take Bean into Eden. Characters Bean, Ryter, and Spaz are not used to society and aspects of Eden. In a quote Lanaya laughs at them when they get a sight of Eden “ Those are real fish, silly, not a holoquarium images” page 158. Right up until the end of the book Lanaya is dedicated to the future society seeing no use in making proovs when babies are all naturally equal. Lanaya’s way of thinking of future society isn’t well liked by the proovs of
